segment.source: Planning How to Save and Deploy the DaRT 7.0 Recovery Image
segment.target: Planning How to Save and Deploy the DaRT 7.0 Recovery Image

segment.source: Planning How to Save and Deploy the DaRT 7.0 Recovery Image
segment.target: Planning How to Save and Deploy the DaRT 7.0 Recovery Image

segment.source: Planning How to Save and Deploy the DaRT 7.0 Recovery Image
segment.target: Planning How to Save and Deploy the DaRT 7.0 Recovery Image

segment.source: Use the information in this section when you plan for saving and deploying the Microsoft Diagnostics and Recovery Toolset (DaRT) 7 recovery image.
segment.target: Use the information in this section when you plan for saving and deploying the Microsoft Diagnostics and Recovery Toolset (DaRT) 7 recovery image.

segment.source: Planning How to Save and Deploy the DaRT Recovery Image
segment.target: Planning How to Save and Deploy the DaRT Recovery Image

segment.source: You can save and deploy the DaRT recovery image by using the following methods.
segment.target: You can save and deploy the DaRT recovery image by using the following methods.

segment.source: When you are determining the method that you will use, consider the advantages and disadvantages of each.
segment.target: When you are determining the method that you will use, consider the advantages and disadvantages of each.

segment.source: Also, consider how you want to use DaRT in your enterprise.
segment.target: Also, consider how you want to use DaRT in your enterprise.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: You might want to use more than one method in your organization.
segment.target: You might want to use more than one method in your organization.

segment.source: For example, you can boot into DaRT from a remote partition for most situations and have a USB flash drive available in case the end-user computer cannot connect to the network.
segment.target: For example, you can boot into DaRT from a remote partition for most situations and have a USB flash drive available in case the end-user computer cannot connect to the network.

segment.source: The following table shows some advantages and disadvantages of each method of using DaRT in your organization.
segment.target: The following table shows some advantages and disadvantages of each method of using DaRT in your organization.

segment.source: Method to Boot into DaRT
segment.target: Method to Boot into DaRT

segment.source: Advantages
segment.target: Advantages

segment.source: Disadvantages
segment.target: Disadvantages

segment.source: From a CD or DVD
segment.target: From a CD or DVD

segment.source: Supports scenarios in which the master boot record (MBR) is corrupted and you cannot access the hard disk.
segment.target: Supports scenarios in which the master boot record (MBR) is corrupted and you cannot access the hard disk.

segment.source: Also supports cases in which there is no network connection.
segment.target: Also supports cases in which there is no network connection.

segment.source: This is most familiar to users of earlier versions of DaRT, and a CD or DVD can be burned directly from the DaRT Recovery Image Wizard.
segment.target: This is most familiar to users of earlier versions of DaRT, and a CD or DVD can be burned directly from the DaRT Recovery Image Wizard.

segment.source: Requires that someone with access to the CD or DVD is physically at the end-user computer to boot into DaRT.
segment.target: Requires that someone with access to the CD or DVD is physically at the end-user computer to boot into DaRT.

segment.source: From a USB flash drive (UFD)
segment.target: From a USB flash drive (UFD)

segment.source: Provides same advantages as booting from a CD or DVD and also provides support to computers that have no CD or DVD drive.
segment.target: Provides same advantages as booting from a CD or DVD and also provides support to computers that have no CD or DVD drive.

segment.source: Requires you to format the UFD before you can use it to boot into DaRT.
segment.target: Requires you to format the UFD before you can use it to boot into DaRT.

segment.source: Also requires that someone with access to the UFD is physically at the end-user computer to boot into DaRT.
segment.target: Also requires that someone with access to the UFD is physically at the end-user computer to boot into DaRT.

segment.source: From a remote (network) partition
segment.target: From a remote (network) partition

segment.source: Lets you boot into DaRT without needing a CD, DVD, or UFD.
segment.target: Lets you boot into DaRT without needing a CD, DVD, or UFD.

segment.source: Also allows for easy upgrades of DaRT because there is only one file location to update.
segment.target: Also allows for easy upgrades of DaRT because there is only one file location to update.

segment.source: Does not work if the end-user computer is not connected to the network.
segment.target: Does not work if the end-user computer is not connected to the network.

segment.source: Widely available to end users and might require additional security considerations when you are creating the recovery image.
segment.target: Widely available to end users and might require additional security considerations when you are creating the recovery image.

segment.source: From a recovery partition
segment.target: From a recovery partition

segment.source: Lets you boot into DaRT without needing a CD, DVD, or UFD that includes instances in which there is no network connectivity.
segment.target: Lets you boot into DaRT without needing a CD, DVD, or UFD that includes instances in which there is no network connectivity.

segment.source: Also, can be implemented and managed as part of your standard Windows image process by using automated distribution tools, such as System Center Configuration Manager.
segment.target: Also, can be implemented and managed as part of your standard Windows image process by using automated distribution tools, such as System Center Configuration Manager.

segment.source: When updating DaRT, requires you to update all computers in your enterprise instead of just one partition (on the network) or device (CD, DVD, or UFD).
segment.target: When updating DaRT, requires you to update all computers in your enterprise instead of just one partition (on the network) or device (CD, DVD, or UFD).

segment.target: Related topics

segment.target: Planning to Deploy DaRT 7.0
